page.title: 14EDUCATION WOODSPRING VILLAGE
page.content: There are no schools in either Wick St. Lawrence or Kingston Seymour. Until the Education act of 1944 pupils stayed in the same school for their entire education. Older children were taken out of the village to secondary modern or grammer schools. Gradually the village schools have been closed owing to the falling school rolls and the difficulties of teaching children of varying ages and abilities in the same classroom and the cost of upkeep of the ageing schools.All the children are now taken out of the village to bigger,more modern schools. This does mean that there are more facilaties and greater chances for extra_curricular activities for them, but it has contributed in some part to the break down of the tight_knit village community of earlier times.
